0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Congenital ichthyosis of skin: apply TOPICALLY to affected area twice daily, rub in thoroughly
  • Dry skin dermatitis: apply TOPICALLY to affected area twice daily, rub in thoroughly

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Congenital ichthyosis of skin: 2 y and older: apply TOPICALLY to affected area twice daily, rub in thoroughly
  • Dry skin dermatitis: 2 y and older: apply TOPICALLY to affected area twice daily, rub in thoroughly

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Congenital ichthyosis of skin
  • Dry skin dermatitis

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• application to abraded skin, fissures or erosions; may result in transient stinging or burning
  • artificial or natural sunlight exposure should be minimized or avoided; discontinue ammonium lactate if hypersensitivity occurs
  • facial application; increased risk of irritation
  • hypersensitivity reactions may occur; discontinuation of ammonium lactate is recommended
  • worsening of skin condition despite application; discontinuation of ammonium lactate is recommended

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
Dermatologic:Burning sensation, Erythema, Skin peeling disorder, Stinging of skin

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Ammonium lactate is a humectant which promotes skin moisture, and reduces epidermal keratinization.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Topical
dermatologic use only; not for ophthalmic, oral or intravaginal use

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Tell patient to avoid or minimize exposure of treated area to artificial or natural sunlight.
  • Drug may cause eczema, erythema, petechiae, or skin peeling, stinging, burning, or irritation.
  • Advise patient to apply drug only to intact skin surfaces and to avoid contact with lips, eyes, or mucous membranes.
